description: Dive into "Cannes Coastal Vibes: Beach Bliss Playlist" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Cannes Coastal Vibes: Beach Bliss Playlist

places.generalDescription: Located alongside the iconic La Croisette boardwalk in Cannes, Croisette Beach is a popular public stretch of sand with a rich history. The area is famous for hosting various congresses and events at the Palais des Festivals, including the renowned International Film Festival. Visitors can also enjoy tours on Le Train du Cinema, exploring attractions like Cannes old town and the Provencal market. Croisette Beach itself offers a spacious sandy shore catering to all visitors, including those with special needs.

sources.snippet: There is a 550 meter long underwater barrier which acts like a coral reef -  you can often see people standing on it - to prevent massive waves hitting the beach along the Croisette in the winter. It cost almost 1.5 million euros and is unique in the south of France. The town has planted scores of palm trees on the public beaches to provide welcome shade.

Beach Croisette is a spacious sandy shore that caters to visitors with special needs. It is popular among the younger generations and is known for its trendy beach bars and upscale restaurants. Beach Midi is a family-friendly beach with calm and clear waters and a well-equipped playground.

Not to be missed: the Palais des Festivals beach and the Croisette beach. Both are large sandy beaches. The Palais des Festivals beach is ideal for children because of its easy access to the water and less frequented than the Croisette beach.

The Plage de la Croisette is Cannes‚Äô most famous beach and it‚Äôs where all the celebrities and socialites come to see and be seen. This 2-kilometer long beach is located along the Promenade de la Croisette, Cannes‚Äô famous seaside walkway.
The East Croisette Beach, very popular, is particularly busy in the summer. It is located in front of the Martinez hotel, positioned at the center of the beach.

places.name: Croisette Beach Cannes

reviews.text: Great beach with plenty of things to do: swim to the sandbank or enjoy a variety of marine activities. Or simply just take a relaxing stroll along the beach. üòÅ
Nice beach, was my favourite, but right now coz of all construction projects going around not so quiet... But still beautiful, if u find your spot.

One of the best beaches I visited in the region, with excellent infrastructure and soft, clean sand. üèñ The beach feels safe, especially for families, thanks to the shallow water and gentle, gradual slope that extends far out. It can get very crowded, but it's still a great spot overall. The main downside is the layout - the central section is taken up by private areas, leaving only the sides for public use. Also, the sunbed vendors are quite pushy and persistent - it feels like a scene from a movie! üé¨üìΩ

sources.snippet: In addition to its deckchairs, Les Cabines offers inventive Mediterranean cuisine using fresh produce. Impeccable service and an elegant, relaxed atmosphere. An unforgettable moment with family or friends during your vacation on the C√¥te d'Azur.

places.name: Les Cabines - Plage Priv√©e

reviews.text: The best way to enjoy the beach in Golfe Juan.  Comfortable lounge chairs with pads and umbrellas. GREAT service from our serveuse, Elena.  She was charasmatic, funny and managed all the guests needs with ease. She spoke some English too  We paid the prix fixe for all day lounge chair and lunch, plus 2-3 drinks each. Came to 50‚Ç¨ per person. we spent about 5 hours there, so we basically had lounge chairs and a private beach for 10‚Ç¨ an hour, and free drinks and food! Definitely wortg the price. Beach was nice and sandy, not rocky. Some street parking and apparently there was a parkling lot down the road a bit.

Everything in Les Cabines is perfect. The service is extraordinally fast starting from bringing coctails to seeing every single person. If you even lift your body of the sunbed to adjust the umbrella there will be someone to help you within  seconds. Drinks are brilliant. Food is delicious and portions are big so the price and quality matches every aspect. Highly recommend this beach. It is a brilliant place to spend a day.

A wonderful place on the beach in Golfe Juan to possibly spend the last day of this summer? Loungers and parasols are comfortable and well spaced and dining facilities similar. Menu is varied and reasonably priced  and the staff are efficient and friendly and Elena is top! Sea was crystal clear and refreshingüòârecommend!
Update 2021 still as good. Great place to spend a day chilling out on this beautiful beach.

places.address: 10 Av. des Fr√®res Roustan, 06220 Vallauris, France

places.generalDescription: Plage du Midi is a vibrant city beach that perfectly captures the essence of Cannes. This long stretch of sandy shoreline offers both public and private areas, making it an ideal spot for everyone from families to sun-seekers. Easily accessible from various transport links, Plage du Midi features beach clubs at one end while providing ample space for relaxation further down the shore. Visitors can enjoy activities like beach volleyball or indulge in watersports, all under the watchful eyes of lifeguards.

sources.snippet: On the western side of Cannes, Plage du Midi is situated close to Le Suquet, the city‚Äôs old quarter, and La Croix-des-Gardes, which is now a public park. The park used to be the grounds of one of the largest villas in the area, and it‚Äôs worth climbing to the top for a picnic before hitting the beach and relaxing. Plage du Midi has a selection of restaurants and ice cream parlours, and most people enjoy the area‚Äôs friendly vibe.

Plage du Midi is a long sandy beach with a mix of public and private space, easily accessible from the train station, bus stops, and town centre. The beach clubs are all clustered up one end before you come to a wide sandy expanse where families can spread out a towel and relax. There are beach volleyball courts, lifeguards, watersports, disabled access, and food kiosks, and there are lots of caf√©s on the promenade if you want to take a break from the sun for lunch.

The beautiful Plage du Midi is located on the Boulevard du Midi, on the West side of town, and is ideal for, sunbathing, swimming, and relaxing with a good book. This 700-meter stretch of white sand beach is lined by spectacular beach clubs and has a super convenient location if you stay in the center of Cannes (read about the best hotels in Cannes here!). The water at Plage du Midi is clean, clear, and shallow, making it ideal for swimming and family-friendly.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches To Visit In Cannes

sources.snippet: On the other hand, the Plages de la Bocca and the Plages du Midi count as the most popular free public beaches, along with the Plage du Casino and Plage Gazagnaire. In addition, the Palm Beach (which does not open out along the La Croisette) is said to be more adequate for spending time with the family, given its rather shallow waters which diminish the risk of unwanted events. As a plus, kite surfing is said to be best enabled in this area.

A short distance west of the Vieux Port de Cannes (Old Port), Plages du Midi boasts a sandy shoreline. Visiting here is one of the best things to do in Cannes. As one of the larger beaches in the area, Plage du Midi will offer you some wonderful space in which to relax and soak up the sun, while still being conveniently situated close to the heart of Cannes and the Old Town.

The Plage du Midi is one of the most popular beaches in Cannes and it‚Äôs easy to see why. This beach is located right in the center of town, so it‚Äôs convenient if you‚Äôre staying in a hotel or apartment nearby. It stretches on for about 700 meters, making it a great spot for people-watching as you can see all the fashionable locals and visitors strolling by.

On Cannes‚Äô western side is Plage du Midi that is located near La Croix-des-Gardes, a public park, and Le Suquet, the city‚Äôs old quarter. Before now, the park was the ground of one of the area‚Äôs villas. You should climb to the summit for a picnic before going to Plage du Midi and relaxing when you visit.

Located in one of the city‚Äôs most picturesque areas, the Plage du Midi is one of the best public beaches in Cannes. The old quarter, ‚ÄòLe Suquet‚Äô, is only a short walk away so you‚Äôll be close to many of Cannes‚Äô attractions. The beach itself is narrow but long, with golden sand and shallow water.
sources.shortName: The Best Private and Public Beaches In Cannes

sources.snippet: Otra opci√≥n es la Plage du Midi, que cuenta con espacios amplios para familiares y zonas con sombras naturales. Ambas playas ofrecen servicios como √°reas de juegos y opciones de restauraci√≥n, garantizando un d√≠a agradable junto al mar.
sources.shortName: Playas en Cannes: un para√≠so de sol y encanto en la Riviera francesa

sources.snippet: Walk east and you come to the free portion of Bijou Plage, which is a non-smoking beach, and Zamenhoff, another managed municipal beach. And even further east is the long stretch of public beach on blvd Gazagnaire.
This lengthy beach stretches between the private beach, Waikiki and the Plage de Sports 700m to the west. Starting in late spring, beach volleyball courts are put up.
From left to right that Gazagnaire Plage, Plage Porto Canto, Plage Croisette Boulevard and the Plage du Midi which passes into the beaches of Mandelieu.
sources.siteName: French Riviera Real Estate Portal C√¥te d'Azur

sources.snippet: This long and thin stretch of white sand beach runs the length of the Boulevard du Midi from the parking at the Vieux Port towards Cannes la Bocca.
Public beach which also is widely played volleyball, a very popular sport in South France. Just beyond lies Plage Laugier.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Cannes and Lerins Island

places.name: Plage du Midi

reviews.text: Very nice beach, with many and many coffees and clubs and restaurants. You will enjoy with the view, many 5 stars hotels are in front of the beach. Many luxury shops as well.
Our fav beach spot in Cannes. Quiet, nice, clean and water is good for swimming. Love it.

Very good sandy beach! Parking on the street/both sides + public parking with more than 150 spots. We went on a saturday 4pm and were lucky to find someone leaving and got their spot.

Calm

places.generalDescription: The Plage Mac√© beach in La Croisette is a great place to relax and swim. It's free to use, has clean water, and is usually quiet in the morning. There are no rocks or wind here, which makes it a calm and safe spot. The only downside is that there are not many places to sit down, so it can get crowded during the summer months.

sources.snippet: For a laid back beach experience in Cannes complete with umbrella and lounge chair rentals, public restrooms, and changing areas, head to Plage Mac√©. This picturesque public strip of sand is located right in front of the Promenade de la Croisette and is monitored by lifeguards for your safety. And if you‚Äôre in the mood for a beach read, you can avail yourself of the Pages √† la Plage library across from the beach, which lends out magazines and books (a few in English) free of charge.

Plage Mac√© is a ‚Äòregie municipal‚Äô beach with a private paid section run by the city of Cannes. Like other private beaches in Cannes, you can rent chairs, umbrellas, and lockers, but Plage Mac√© offers significantly lower prices. It has toilets, showers, kiosks changing rooms, and lifeguards.
sources.shortName: The Best Private and Public Beaches In Cannes

sources.snippet: During the Cannes Film Festival a large screen is placed for the audience to watch special avant premieres. Walk left along the surf (direction Nice) then you get to Plage Casino, also called C Plage.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Cannes and Lerins Island

places.name: Plage Mac√©

reviews.text: Came to Cannes for a night during the Cannes Film Festival (2025) so I could watch the free public screenings that start from 9:30pm onwards everyday during the festival. I started to queue for it at least 2 hours before so I was fairly near the start of the queue. It did fill up quickly so I would advise queueing up early to get a deck chair spot but you could just fully bring a beach towel and sit outside the cordoned area to watch without queueing. They did provide blankets as it does get chilly, but I'd still advise bringing a light jacket if you plan to stay long.
The beach is good but i find a lot of glass in the sand and i think the showers are very dirty the water is not good but it's okay to spend a few hours
Peaceful, joyful, lovely. The water and the beach is clean. Surroundings are lovely

places.generalDescription: √éle Saint-Honorat is a picturesque island in the L√©rins group, known for its 15th-century fortified Cistercian monastery. The island is covered with vineyards and is home to some of France's last winemaking monks. Visitors can taste and purchase award-winning wines at a special degustation room and enjoy a meal at a high-quality restaurant.

sources.snippet: While √éle Saint-Honorat, one of the L√©rins Islands, isn‚Äôt particularly well-known for its beach culture, you still swim here from the pebbly beach. This works well if √éle Saint-Honorat and its fortified Monasterio de L√©rins Cistercian abbey are big on your list of places to visit in Cannes‚Äîbut you also want to play in the water. The beaches on the serene √éle Saint-Honorat, where no cars are allowed, tend to be rocky and not large in scale.

places.name: √éle Saint-Honorat

reviews.text: This place is a short cruise trip from Cannes. Boats start leaving from 10 am in morning and last from the island is around 430 pm, never miss it. You can spend a whole day exploring this small but beautiful island. There are multiple small beaches to swim and sun bathe. One of the destination of French Riviera.

Such a beautiful island! I definitely prefer this island to the bigger one. There are a lot less people and have quite a few cute quiet beaches. It takes a couple of hours to walk around the whole island but I definitely think you can make a whole day of it if you relax by the beach and then go sightseeing.

Beautiful, quiet, secluded island with a monastery and vineyards. Like l'√Æle Sainte-Marguerite, it is only accessible by ferry. There is a lovely, short walk around the island, and a nice restaurant overlooking the water.

places.generalDescription: The Carlton Beach Club is a chic restaurant located in Cannes, offering a laid-back beachside atmosphere and serving seafood, grilled meats, and cocktails. The venue is known for its vibrant ambiance and is a popular spot throughout the day. With friendly staff and a variety of unique cocktails and regional wines available, it's an ideal place to unwind by the beach. The Carlton Terrace is particularly famous for its lively atmosphere, where guests can enjoy drinks while watching the stars descend upon the red carpet.

sources.snippet: All of the major hotels along La Croisette have their own private beaches (like the Martinez, or the Marriott), and the InterContinental Carlton Hotel is no exception. Offering loungers, waiter service, showers and lockers to keep your valuables safe, Carlton Beach is a great option, and it‚Äôs also conveniently located. These beaches are more built up, with tables, chairs and floats, so they might not be as pretty at first glance, but the water is perfect and the premises clean.

Carlton beach is a private beach owned by Hotel Carlton, just like the main hotels along La Croisette have their own private beaches (such as the Marriott or the Martinez). It offers waiter service, loungers, and lockers to keep precious items- this beach is a brilliant option and is located in a nice environment. Carlton beach is built with tables, floats, and chairs; therefore it might not look appealing initially, but the water is great, and the surrounding is super clean.

The beach of the Hotel Barri√®re Le Gray d‚ÄôAlbion, at the Majestic Hotel, is home to the BFire restaurant. The establishment is renowned for its cuisine with Mediterranean and Asian influences. The private beach offers deckchairs for rent on the sand or on the pontoon.

places.name: Carlton Beach Club

reviews.text:
We had an amazing time at the Carlton Beach Club! The food was delicious, the service excellent, and the team was super accommodating when our friends arrived ‚Äì they quickly arranged a large table for all of us.
A special shoutout to Maud for her warm smile and kindness throughout the service, it truly made the experience even better.
We absolutely loved it, thanks to the whole team! ‚ú®

We had a lovely experience at Carlton Beach Club in Cannes, a refined and elegant spot located right on the beach, with unbeatable views and a luxurious yet relaxed atmosphere.

The food and service were both excellent. The menu isn't vast, as you'd expect from more exclusive venues, but it's well curated and focused on quality. We ordered the pesto pasta and half chicken for mains, both beautifully prepared, before sharing a dessert right by the sea.

Service was attentive without being intrusive. I was unsure what to drink, and after a quick chat with our server about my preferences, I was recommended a glass of champagne, which turned out to be the perfect choice. Their suggestions were spot on throughout.

If you want to stay and enjoy the beach loungers but aren't a hotel guest, there is a surcharge per sunbed, around ‚Ç¨30 each from memory, so worth bearing in mind if you're planning to spend the afternoon. That said, it's an ideal place to relax for a special treat or beachside lunch. Highly recommended booking in advance, as you'd expect it gets very busy as priority is given to hotel guests.

The overall bill came to around ‚Ç¨100‚Äì‚Ç¨150 for two people, including two mains, one dessert to share, and drinks. For the location, quality, and service, we found it to be very fair value and would definitely return.

We had high expectations when we went and they were completely fulfilled. The food and drinks were on point and the atmosphere was top notch. But the key difference was the service. It was spectacular! Madeleine and the rest of the staff attended us with high standards, always with smiles and went the extra mile to make sure our stay was as pleasant as possible taking into account the scorching heat of the sun. I would return to Cannes just to relive this experience all over again. Thanks Madeleine and the Carlton Beach Club for a memorable day at the beach!

places.address: 58 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: L'Alba is a stylish beach restaurant located in Cannes, offering Mediterranean seafood and cocktails in a bamboo pavilion with DJ sets and sunbeds. It's popular among locals and tourists for its wide-ranging food menu, friendly service, and superb view of the cerulean waters. The constantly changing menu features fresh local seafood, as well as organic meat and poultry sourced from the surrounding area.

sources.snippet: This warm and relaxed place allows you to enjoy European cuisine and discover excellent cocktails. The O‚ÄôKey Beach allows you to enjoy fish dishes and Italian recipes.

places.name: L'Alba - Beach Restaurant

reviews.text: Had a wonderful day at this beach club. Food, particularly the scallops was exceptional. Wine also delicious and not insanely priced like other places in Cannes. Highly recommend and we will definitely be back.

The location is excellent, especially if you can snag a seat near the surf - the atmosphere is undeniably charming. Service is decent, nothing to complain about.

As for the food‚Ä¶ perhaps we hit an off night. The lamb arrived as three nearly pure chunks of fat - disappointing, to say the least. Luckily, the bread saved the day. Fresh, warm, and absolutely delicious.

Pro tip: Skip the lamb and go straight for the bread - it's the safest bet on the menu.

Great atmosphere and a stunning setting to enjoy the Cannes fireworks. The food is OK, the starters are huge and delicious but the mains, my steak in particular, are disappointing. The service was friendly and relaxed, but it is the location and views that steal the show! Dog and children friendly.

places.generalDescription: La Plage du Martinez in Cannes is a luxurious beach club that offers an atmosphere of opulence and relaxation on the stunning palm-lined beachfront. It's part of the legendary Hotel Martinez, known for its signature blue and white colors creating a true Mediterranean vibe. The beach club provides various experiences, from lounging on comfortable sun loungers to enjoying live music while basking in the sun.

sources.snippet: In this respect, some of the highest rated sunbathing venues refer to, for instance, the Martinez Beach (Plage du Martinez) owned by the homonymous hotel, which is best known for its constant reference to the Cannes Film Festival. The Royal Beach (Plage Royal) is yet another popular hotspot, belonging to the Grand Hotel. Noga Hilton, Carlton or the Majestic also have their own beaches, which goes without saying.

places.name: La Plage du Martinez

reviews.text: Excellent service with Kateryna, Yannick and Alberto at the terrace during lunch time. Isabelle was also a great hostess. She helped us a lot to manage a comfortable seat despite the critical and noisy renovation on the pier. We finally enjoyed the beach side of the hotel and a pleasant lunch with very attentive staff and smiling team. One only small detail is about the wine service : please always ask to taste the wine before you pour the glasses. My two guests felt a bit embarrassed...
Beautiful beach restaurant connected to the Hotel Martinez on the Croisette in Cannes. We came here for drinks. It was lovely to sit on the beach and take in the magnificent view.

We spent beautiful days at the Beach in Cannes and this place was amazing , the beach , the food and the exceptional service were incredible.
We recommend to reserve in advance because , during the summer , even though is not too crowded, guests use the infrastructure.
Highly recommended!!!
Even though all the employees and staff  are ready to help , Camille was exceptional with us .
Will be back !

places.address: 73 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: Promenade de la Croisette is a famous boulevard in Cannes, resembling Nice's Promenade des Anglais. This 1.2-mile pedestrian-friendly walkway runs along the Mediterranean Sea, lined with palm trees, beautiful beaches, luxury hotels, and upscale restaurants. Visitors can enjoy strolling by a small marina and luxury shops like Dior and Chanel. The waterfront avenue offers picturesque beaches, cafes, boutiques, and lavish hotels.

sources.snippet: Cannes se presenta como un destino ideal para quienes buscan disfrutar del sol y la belleza del mar en un ambiente inigualable. Desde las vibrantes playas de la Croisette hasta las tranquilas y familiares opciones como la Playa del Hotel Carlton, cada espacio ofrece una experiencia √∫nica. La Riviera francesa se convierte as√≠ en un refugio perfecto para relajarse y conectarse con la naturaleza en un entorno deslumbrante.
sources.shortName: Playas en Cannes: un para√≠so de sol y encanto en la Riviera francesa

sources.snippet: The Plage de la Croisette is Cannes‚Äô most famous beach and it‚Äôs where all the celebrities and socialites come to see and be seen. This 2-kilometer long beach is located along the Promenade de la Croisette, Cannes‚Äô famous seaside walkway.

places.name: Promenade de la Croisette

reviews.text:
It's very beautiful but too busy.
Still nice place to take a walk.

The Promenade de la Croisette is the waterfront avenue with palm trees. La Croisette is known for picturesque beaches, restaurants, caf√©s, boutiques and luxury hotels. Le Suquet, the old town, provides a good view of La Croisette. It's a very pleasant and leisurely walk along the boulevard, even though many sections are under construction and renovation.

The Promenade de la Croisette in Cannes is a picturesque and glamorous waterfront boulevard stretching along the Mediterranean coast. Located near the famous H√¥tel Barri√®re Le Majestic Cannes, this iconic promenade is known for its stunning views, luxurious boutiques, and chic caf√©s. It offers a perfect blend of leisure and elegance, making it a popular spot for leisurely strolls, people-watching, and enjoying the vibrant atmosphere of Cannes. The promenade is also a hub during the Cannes Film Festival, attracting celebrities and film enthusiasts from around the world.

places.address: 57 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: Plage de la Bocca, located in Cannes, is a popular sandy city beach that offers various activities such as swimming, sunbathing, and volleyball. It is known for its laid-back atmosphere and is less crowded compared to other beaches in the area. The beach has easy access and features golden fine sand and turquoise water. While it can get crowded during the peak season, there are nearby eateries and free parking available.

sources.snippet: Plage de la Bocca is one of the most popular public beaches in Cannes. Just like the surrounding neighbourhood, there is a more laid-back side of the city on show here. It‚Äôs further west around the bay from La Croisette, close to the airport, but that‚Äôs part of the attraction; it can be a little less hectic in the summer months.

On the other hand, the Plages de la Bocca and the Plages du Midi count as the most popular free public beaches, along with the Plage du Casino and Plage Gazagnaire. In addition, the Palm Beach (which does not open out along the La Croisette) is said to be more adequate for spending time with the family, given its rather shallow waters which diminish the risk of unwanted events. As a plus, kite surfing is said to be best enabled in this area.

Located next to the port, Plage de La Bocca is a stunning and often overlooked beach located on the outskirts of Cannes that is perfect for sunbathing, swimming, and enjoying the view of the boats coming in and out of the port. Known for its vibrant atmosphere, fine sand, and crystal-clear waters. This beach also has plenty of amenities such as bars and restaurants, as well as child-friendly activities like kayaking and paddleboarding.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches To Visit In Cannes

sources.snippet: Plage de la Bocca sits right next to the city‚Äôs main port, which is part of what makes it one of the busiest public beaches in Cannes. This beach and the surrounding area are a little more laid back compared to other parts of the city. There‚Äôs plenty of space to relax on the golden sand under the warm sun and it‚Äôs also a great place for water sports like kayaking and jet skiing.
sources.shortName: The Best Private and Public Beaches In Cannes

sources.snippet: Plage de la Bocca, close to the La Bocca train station, is located in the western part of the city. With its long stretch of golden sand, tranquil seafront esplanade, and large boulders at either end, Plage de la Bocca is a prime location for soaking in some sun or going for a dip in the sea. It‚Äôs also one of the best beaches in the French Riviera for snorkeling.

The Plage de la Bocca is one of the busiest beaches in Cannes, but it‚Äôs still a great spot for swimming, sunbathing, and people-watching. This beach is located just next to the port, so you can watch all the boats coming and going while you‚Äôre relaxing on the sand or on your lounge chair.

Plage de la Bocca is a public beach and one of the widest known public beaches in the city. Similar to the surrounding area, there is a more mellowed side of Cannes on show here. From La Croisette, the beach is westward around the bay, near the airport.
On La Bocca beach, Le Cabanon offers local fish and a rotisserie. The private beach offers deckchair rentals. You can refresh yourself by sipping a cocktail or a glass of champagne (in moderation).
A special place with a striking rocky outcrop protruding from the water. This is the second beach in Cannes where it is forbidden to smoke.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Cannes and Lerins Island

sources.siteName: French Riviera Real Estate Portal C√¥te d'Azur

places.name: Plage de la Bocca

reviews.text: Small but lovely beach next to the road. Crazy beautiful color of the sea. Water soo warm and comfy. San more gray than gold. Shower next to entrance to the beach, very convenient. Not soo crowded. Great spot for relax and swim in the sea. Me and my GF had really great time there. Recommend!

So, the water's clear, the sand's clean, and it's easy to get to from the A8 highway. You can park for free right nearby (but get there early, it fills up fast!). No pebbles, the water's shallow and smooth, perfect for a hand-in-hand swim with my sweetie. <3

A few downsides: No restaurants right on the beach, just kiosks for snacks or coffee (convenient, but not super romantic).
A really nice beach to relax. It gets a bit crowded between 12 and 5 PM, but the water and the beach are very clean and feel safe.

places.generalDescription: Bd de la Croisette, also known as the Boulevard la Croisette, is a renowned seaside promenade in Cannes. It has a rich history, originally following an ancient seaside road and now famous for hosting events like the Festival International du Film. The boulevard is lined with luxury shops, high-end hotels, and exquisite dining options.

sources.snippet: Boulevard de la Croisette is a genuine backbone of Cannes, since it generally delineates the lay out of the main attractions of the city, namely, its beaches. Indeed, the beaches in Cannes are the closest thing to the idea of symbol of this French Riviera resort. Beaches in Cannes divide into two categories.

The downside of Cannes beaches is that the prime beach locations along La Croisette have been commandeered by the fancy hotels lining the boulevard and you have to pay to use them. For a lounge chair and parasol for the day, prices start at 25 in high season.
The Croisette has long stretches of fine sand along the turquoise waters. Which of the many private and public beaches in Cannes are ideal for children?. To enjoy a pleasant...
sources.shortName: Where to go to the beach in Cannes?

places.name: Bd de la Croisette

reviews.text: Among the movie stars! Beautiful boulevard where you can find nice restaurants,fancy boutiques and hotels.The beach is amazing.
Very nice street with shops and restaurants üòÉ

One of the most beautiful cities in Europe that I have visited. It really exudes unusual beauty and romance. The buildings are beautiful and I really like that kind of architecture. Along the coast of Cannes, there are beaches along almost the entire length. They are very clean and it is a real pleasure to swim. Lots of restaurants for every taste and pocket. And of course La Croisette! Beautiful!
I will be happy to visit Cannes again!

places.generalDescription: Plage des Rochers de la Bocca is a stunning beach in Cannes known for its striking blend of turquoise blue Mediterranean waters and deep red rocks. It's less crowded compared to other popular beaches in the area, making it an ideal spot for relaxation. The shoreline offers freshwater showers, but there are no toilet facilities available. Visitors can find parking options within walking distance from the beach. The crystal-clear waters and spacious layout make it a favorite among tourists, especially during the less crowded months.

sources.snippet: The blend of turquoise blue Mediterranean and deep red rock make Plage des Rochers a treat to the eyes, and it is often less crowded. Along the shoreline, there are freshwater showers; however, there are no toilets. You will find a free car park about 200 m from Plage des Rochers beach and parking along the major road of Boulevard du Mid that courses along the beach‚Äôs back.

The Plage des Rochers de la Bocca is roughly 20 minutes from the main La Bocca beach on foot. Don‚Äôt forget to bring a phone or camera to capture the large, red rocks that emerge dramatically out of the emerald water at the shoreline. It‚Äôs right next door to the Cannes la Bocca train station and there‚Äôs a free car park about 200 meters away.
sources.shortName: The Best Private and Public Beaches In Cannes

places.name: Plage des Rochers de la Bocca

reviews.text: Lovely beach and flat promenade
Great beach if you're visiting with a child. Comfortable entry into the water. There's a nearby kiosk with drinks and ice cream.
I don't know about parking a car, but by foot this is amazing beach, big, not crowded (september), very beautiful

places.generalDescription: Zamenhof Beach, situated on the east side of a sheltered cove, offers shallow waters ideal for swimming. Managed by the city, it provides amenities such as toilets, lockers, showers, and changing rooms. Despite being near the marina, the beach remains clean with lovely water. It can get crowded during peak season but is generally a nice spot to relax on smooth sand. Visitors have praised its romantic and stunning setting with warm water and beautiful views.

sources.snippet: Plage Zamenhof is located on the east side of the long cove that is sheltered from the wind; the water here is shallow, making it a great spot for swimming. Parking can be frustrating here; however, at the Parc Croisette‚Äôs underground parking is a paid parking option. The strip of sandy beach is managed by the city, meaning that there are specific services offered, including toilets, lockers, showers, and changing rooms.

places.name: Zamenhof - plage publique de Cannes

reviews.text: One of the best beaches in tge area! Great views, nice sand and very clean public washroom. Very close to the nice parking garage.

This is a pubic beach. Part of it you can rent loungers and umbrellas for around 10-15 euros per day. The other part is just beach toy bring your own stuff. The water is clear and the beach is nice and sandy. The water depth increases quite quickly but is very nice
This beach is fine, but most of the time too full so not the best choice if you wanna enjoy relaxing and quiet day.

places.generalDescription: Waikiki - Restaurant Plage is a sleek venue located on a private beach, offering a delightful dining experience with seafood, steaks, and grilled fish paired with Proven√ßal wines. Guests can indulge in the quality of seafood while enjoying the romantic setting and great service. The mussels and fries are particularly recommended, accompanied by flavorful white wine sauce.

sources.snippet: Waikiki Plage transports you to an exotic paradise of yucca and bamboo. Let yourself be seduced by its lounge atmosphere and breathtaking view of the Mediterranean Sea. With comfortable deckchairs and beds, a Mediterranean-style restaurant, a friendly bar, disabled access and nearby parking, Waikiki Plage has everything to charm you.

Waikiki Plage offers Mediterranean cuisine, to be enjoyed on the terrace facing the sea, as well as deckchairs and mattresses for rent. L‚ÄôAlba, open late in the evening, seduces night owls. This warm and relaxed place allows you to enjoy European cuisine and discover excellent cocktails.

places.name: Waikiki - Restaurant Plage

reviews.text:
What a marvellous experience we had at Waikiki Plage.

Although the weather was not the greatest, we had such a great time here. My wife, Corina, our lovely puppy, Molly üê∂ and I, were welcomed by Marie-Jeanne and she served us with such kindness, she took care of Molly, as she was soaking wet, she brought us a towel and she looked after us the whole time.

We felt so welcomed and we enjoyed our afternoon here, serving some delicious Oysters and a bottle of Prosecco.

The deserts were absolutely app√©tissant. Merci Chef üëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèª

Thank you so much Marie-Jeanne four everything, we will definitely come back here on our next trip from London ‚ù§Ô∏è

Incredible spot. ‚Ç¨20/‚Ç¨25 to rent the lounger for the day on a magnificent beach. The food here is worth the hype too. The duck was so tasty. The beach server was very friendly and attentive. I'll be back for sure xw

If you're not going to the beach club, definitely stop here for a drink at night! They have several low beach chairs in front of the water and it is gorgeous. Just be aware that the ‚Äòlarge' beer is a liter!

places.generalDescription: Nestled along the stunning Croisette beach, Vegaluna is a chic beach club that perfectly captures the Mediterranean spirit. With its expansive seafront terrace, it offers diners breathtaking views of Cannes' iconic hotels while indulging in delectable seafood and sharing plates crafted by Chef Antoine Regnault. The menu highlights seasonal produce sourced from local markets, ensuring each meal is fresh and vibrant.

sources.snippet: There are lots of private beach clubs to choose from along the beachfront in Cannes, where you can rent deckchairs, drink cocktails and eat a lovely lunch at tables in the sand. However, some are a bit too refined to be able to really relax with the kids. Our pick of the family-friendly beach clubs is Vegaluna Beach, which has a kindergarten, a baby club, watersports, beach swings, slides and a play area on the beach.

places.name: Vegaluna

reviews.text: The food was simply amazing, every dish was full of flavor and beautifully presented. The ambiance was unmatched, with a breathtaking sunset view right on the beach and an incredible live singer that elevated the whole vibe. It was the perfect mix of elegance and chill, and we had an unforgettable evening. Definitely a must-visit spot in Cannes!

I am really surprised by the service. It was so nice and friendly, nothing fancy at all (in a good way!). We really liked our entr√©e (watermelon, feta) and octopus and sea bass as a dish. We will certainly come again. The atmosphere is Mediterranean and relaxing‚Ä¶

The best beach club in Cannes ‚Äì the beach is unbelievably clean, and the staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming. I've never experienced such care and warmth in any other beach club. The food is delicious, and I will definitely come back again!

places.address: Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: Plage de la Raguette offers a more relaxed atmosphere compared to popular beaches like Plage de la Croisette. It's a great spot for a sun-filled day, but visitors should bring their own beach essentials as there are no beach clubs or restaurants nearby. The beach features fine sand and clear waters, making it easy to take a refreshing swim. There are amenities such as water taps, a kiosk offering food and drinks, and even free toilets available.

sources.snippet: Definitely more low-key than the other beaches in Cannes, Plage de La Raguette is a public beach located on the far east side of town and offers a more peaceful atmosphere without sacrificing amenities or beautiful views. The beach is lined with coconut trees for shade, making it ideal for relaxing with a good book and it also has a prime location for taking in the views of Chateau de la Napoule and the marina. Peaceful and quiet, this beach is perfect for families.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches To Visit In Cannes

sources.snippet: Close to the beautifully restored Chateau de la Napoule, this small beach is a wonderful hidden gem just outside of Cannes in Mandelieu-la-Napoule. It‚Äôs a calm, sheltered beach that stays quite shallow, which makes it great for families with young children. You can grab a bite to eat with views of the ocean at the nearby Restaurant La Rotonde.
sources.shortName: The Best Private and Public Beaches In Cannes

sources.snippet: This beach is definitely more low-key than beaches like the Plage de la Croisette, but it‚Äôs still a great spot to spend a day in the sun. Just be sure to bring your own towel and beach chair as there are no beach clubs or restaurants nearby.

places.name: Plage de la Raguette

reviews.text:
Beautiful beach, loads of places to eat and drink.
Lovely clean water for swimming

Nice beachside directly in front of the castle of La Napoule. Its fitted with toilet and some showering possibilities. Also there is a kiosk to get necessarities if wanted. The water rises very slow,so its wonderful for little children. Recommendations for this nice place.

New place of the restaurant, new choices and new place to eat for dinner lunch etc. Once more a nice place to be....

Nice, little, public beach with fine sand. You can walk out quite a ways before it gets deep so a great place for kids to play. Gets busy during the day but you are rewarded with a great view of the castle

places.address: 209 Rue de la Plage, 06210 Mandelieu-la-Napoule, France

places.generalDescription: Scenic coastal stretch features a sandy beach, shallow torquoise waters & nearby cafes.

sources.snippet: Heading west of the main Cannes beaches, you‚Äôll find the captivating Plage du Ch√¢teau, located in Th√©oule sur Mer. Plage du Ch√¢teau offers both public and private sandy areas, along with breathtaking views of the Bay of Cannes. It‚Äôs a sublime destination for relaxation, swimming, snorkeling, paddle boarding, and sunbathing, letting you take in all of the coastal charm that France is known for.

places.name: Plage du Ch√¢teau

reviews.text: Amazing little sand beach with cristal clear water, great for snorkeling as you can see so many fish, with parking, toilets and safeguards. Also with beautiful views. What more can you wish for?
My favourite beach in the area!
Sat in bar area for a beer ; no chair charges

places.generalDescription: Plage publique du Palais des Festivals is a beautiful and bustling beach located in the heart of Cannes, offering stunning views of the sea and Antibes. Despite its narrowness and popularity, the atmosphere is vibrant and enjoyable. Visitors can admire cruise ships anchored off the coast and observe various water sports activities. The beach is known for its cleanliness, with clear and pleasantly warm waters even in October.

sources.snippet: Not to be missed: the Palais des Festivals beach and the Croisette beach. Both are large sandy beaches. The Palais des Festivals beach is ideal for children because of its easy access to the water and less frequented than the Croisette beach.

places.name: Plage publique du Palais des Festivals

reviews.text:
December dreams,  sun, blue sky,  people walking, dog's plying.
Paradise in Cannes last 48 hours of 2024.

Unfortunately, this beach is almost always closed due to ongoing construction or events in the past few years. When it is open, the condition isn't great either. The area often gets dirty due to the boats passing by, leaving trash and debris behind. It's a shame because the location has great potential, but the maintenance and accessibility have not been up to expectations. If you're looking for a clean and accessible spot, you might want to consider other beaches nearby.
There is a quite small stripp for visitors that don't want to pay for a sunbed. Therefore  it is also very crowded. Prices varied from 35 to 50 ‚Ç¨ for each beachbed at high season.

places.generalDescription: La plage du Ch√¢teau is a stunning beach that offers a unique blend of natural beauty and historical charm. With its soft, fine sand and crystal-clear waters, it's the perfect spot for families looking to enjoy a day by the sea. The beach is well-equipped with amenities like showers and toilets, ensuring comfort for all visitors. Safety is prioritized here, thanks to lifeguards on duty and netting around the swimming area.

sources.snippet: The beach for sports enthusiasts; here many volleyball matches are played. If you walk through, just before the turn of the beach, you see Plage Zamenhoff.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Cannes and Lerins Island

places.name: La plage du Ch√¢teau

reviews.text: This is a beautiful beach with sand instead of rocks. The water is clear and cold. Netting around the area ensures that it is safe to swim and there are also lifeguards around the coast. It is not every day you can tell someone that you swam in pristine waters right next to a castle. You can also visit the castle and wander around without a tour guide, though a tour guide is optional and required to be inside the castle building. Without the tour guide, you can explore the castle grounds and even enjoy the scenery looking over the water.

The entrance to the water is gradual, with no large waves, making it perfect for a relaxing swim. There's also a shop nearby for convenience, adding to the overall experience. A great spot to enjoy the beach in peace and comfort! Highly recommended for families or anyone looking for a calm beach day.
amazing beautiful place. the view with the castle, the harbour, the restaurants at the harbour.... the water is crystal clear! i loved it here!

places.generalDescription: O‚ÄôKey Beach - Restaurant Plage is a delightful casual dining destination nestled along the stunning coastline of Cannes, just beyond the charming Le Suquet neighborhood. This trendy beach club boasts outdoor seating that offers breathtaking views of the sea, making it an ideal spot to unwind with a refreshing cocktail or indulge in classic bites. The restaurant specializes in fresh seafood and Mediterranean-inspired dishes, ensuring a delectable experience for all diners.
places.name: O‚ÄôKey Beach - Restaurant Plage

reviews.text:
We have spend 7 days on this wonderful beach in Cannes and we had a great experience! The beach is wonderful, water is azure and clean, perfect also for kids, sand is clean and soft as silk. A very important aspect is that  on this beach we found very civilized people, even though some of them with kids (as myself) they were not noisy and the kids played nicely together.
The food was amazing, the service and the staff were the kindest and happiest people at work that I have met. High quality beach at affordable prices!!! Really made my vacation a bliss!
We loved it here! The food was amazing, the staff was so friendly and service was great. I had the tuna tartar and my husband had the poke bowl - the fish was so fresh and delicious

The food is not fine dining but always consistent and good, the service is pretty good and the menu is a crowd pleaser if you have a group with different tastes, we take groups there often for that reason. And of course a lovely view üåä

sources.snippet: On the other hand, the Plages de la Bocca and the Plages du Midi count as the most popular free public beaches, along with the Plage du Casino and Plage Gazagnaire. In addition, the Palm Beach (which does not open out along the La Croisette) is said to be more adequate for spending time with the family, given its rather shallow waters which diminish the risk of unwanted events. As a plus, kite surfing is said to be best enabled in this area.

Travel further around the Cap de la Croisette and you will reach Port Palm Beach, Gazagnaire Plage and the beaches of Le Moure Rouge. All of these are less frequented by tourists and, as such, have fewer amenities and no beach clubs with the exception of Bijou Plage. Although you can still be guaranteed crystal clear waters for swimming.
From left to right that Gazagnaire Plage, Plage Porto Canto, Plage Croisette Boulevard and the Plage du Midi which passes into the beaches of Mandelieu.
sources.siteName: French Riviera Real Estate Portal C√¥te d'Azur

reviews.text: Top class free public beach. Clear water, very soft sand without cobblestones. Relatively less crowded. Parking on the street directly next to the beach possible. Several showers available. Free toilet can be found a bit into the city (opposite to a pharmacy)
Bit dirty beach but a raw atmosphere. We went there when there was a strong wind so crazy, but it was wild and amazing to watch windsurfers.

Super beach. It is more quite compate to other beaches.

Here you can rent cayaks and SUPs. In water I snorkelled and were fish and many algues. It was interesting.
